6189D88E0A3E415F8556EEDBB0593834.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement

1C222D379C234A36BA691658FF93E81B.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, • opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

828B2BEDF8A44B57A61496462B8633BD.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

7D83B15E124B4C0C982540801548F245.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

4693005F87CE48FBA00E8A0D32D33C81.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?,  What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

25EB531F7C4A4831BD749A6287B6B7C2.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

9637E1BA0F36444CB2CB376E914F2135.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

DC814D9E9F2F4F0EB07332DA15A50AE5.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

CF1D36D2DAF84CBA901E4B7861A0DE91.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

EF48EE152869413586845188F65BF3AB.description: Develop a plan to attain a job of personal interest in the drafting field.

0B838B59AD5D4406BAF18B8A888DAA9E.description: Analyze personal suitability or non-suitability for a specific drafting related occupation considering criteria such as: initial and continuing educational requirements; duties and skills required for this occupation; the work environment, including typical hours and shifts worked and typical locations; current wages received in Saskatchewan and how these compare to the rest of Canada; physical, mental and emotional stresses related to this occupation; workplace hazards and safety considerations; other occupations with which they interact; professional and/or licensing requirements in Canada and Saskatchewan; and, future trends impacting the occupation.

C352AB13066745FC89C6E116AC55D716.description: Interview or connect with others to discuss drafting related occupations.

719330C6B86C44F3A197C35241519151.description: Discuss the roles, responsibilities, educational qualifications and personal and professional qualities common to people involved in mechanical drafting related careers.

0F66508D08894592A340E1827792B388.description: Analyze mechanical drafting related occupations in Saskatchewan, Canada and the world.

BF0621FB38754BB9BC23C7A09B70C6FA.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

F173143D59B54FDE854FA5434C50E52C.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

93AAC470FFDF4D94994F93692768BDE6.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?,  What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

C2846299DB674D67B13738865DB540F1.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

1F846134B69D487BB73874EDCC0FD2AB.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

B8AFE230D87A4B6D84B3CDCB52364F3B.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

2398E7F5628A4AEF907EB2DDA82A7AD6.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations

2E67C809A0254116ADF636A03531CDA6.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

90ACCF40F3194CD9AB792A39A04758E6.description: Develop a plan to attain a job of personal interest in the drafting field.

7AD483F773844746967157F461391516.description: Analyze personal suitability or non-suitability for a specific drafting related occupation considering criteria such as: initial and continuing educational requirements; duties and skills required for this occupation; the work environment, including typical hours and shifts worked and typical locations; current wages received in Saskatchewan and how these compare to the rest of Canada; physical, mental and emotional stresses related to this occupation; workplace hazards and safety considerations; other occupations with which they interact; professional and/or licensing requirements in Canada and Saskatchewan; and future trends impacting the occupation.

53DDC56826AF4156A3847C74DEBC89DF.description: Interview or connect with others to discuss drafting related occupations.

1EF9AEBADB964CD59E443CC8CC7AC9C8.description: Identify which drafting and computer-aided design related occupations are facing shortages and which are oversubscribed locally, regionally and/or nationally.

3B270A8C4C744B7688611DF4B29E3404.description: Investigate gender diversity careers related to architectural drafting in Saskatchewan, Canada and the world.

65DC2501712B432B9EE791EA893C19A6.description: Discuss the roles, responsibilities, educational qualifications and personal and professional qualities common to people involved in architectural related careers.

1CB135E11A8E443CBF75B71D51BE76F2.description: Analyze architecture related occupations in Saskatchewan, Canada and the world.

1409C142DDFC421E9A48A834CBCC29C1.description: Reflect how BIM can create project efficiencies (e.g., improve facility management and operational maintenance; deliver projects on time and under budget; help develop more innovative and sustainable designs; improve communication with clients).

57FDD36A2E3C4CA491C25224839089E1.description: Collaborate as a team to plan and carry out a BIM inquiry project, including: discussing personal and team members’ skills and interests; assigning roles and responsibilities; developing timelines to manage project; and, reflecting on personal contribution to the team and collaborative team performance.

9F574156DAD64FCE8E9DC7065A3A8673.description: Select a BIM inquiry project as a team.

279B95973C33463B8E75ADE338279938.description: Research to develop knowledge and understanding of required components of BIM projects.

C6927FD0BDBD466AA007AAB6B7815254.description: Collaborate with peers to design and implement a detailed exploration of a BIM project.

271A415AFAEE4A3B9F83DBC48C4F15BD.description: Reflect on and share with peers the successes and challenges experienced during the project development. Consider the inquiry questions: How might the knowledge gained through this project be used to inform future projects? How might the learnings transfer to a future workplace project?

26C9A4FB53B94AE499D066D93CA64172.description: Identify options (e.g., using LISP programming, Python programming to automate repetitive tasks) for streamlining workflow for the next project.

6AAF7DFA92D848469ACFFE8631F5D6C4.description: Present and share the results of the project.

B56759D18E724270BCFADF3F785192E1.description: Develop an assessment of personal skills, attitudes, work habits, and the final product.

A59E3D0DC47D4C448F027075608E9234.description: Construct a tool (e.g., rubric, checklist, self or peer evaluation form) to assess the process and product.

6E8941777C0647928FB8DA0DCFE968ED.description: Create professional drawings in consideration of industry standards.

5FE60E15C41E4B788EE297F955C2D252.description: Produce drawings with all required detail views for a sheet set, including: presentation elevation; presentation floor plan; floor plan; foundation plan; elevation plan; wall section; and, site plan

1F92E951001149D084F23A38D0C643A7.description: Select the software program required for the project.

CF21820BE48F417EA291B15C3DDFF537.description: Conduct an inquiry of required tools, skills and timelines associated with a selected project.

F802BE6E640F41439A8264C5B1C52EE7.description: Demonstrate increasing proficiency of architectural drafting skills to complete a project.

062CB7B96C344C2886F7F0CD4F2DAF62.description: Create a residential design for personal use and apply qualities of good functional design, such as: • investigating relevant building codes and by-laws; • analyzing options for house size and orientation on lot; • dividing home into zones (e.g., living; sleeping, cooking and dining spaces); • investigating and applying coordination of exterior design with the surrounding landscape; and, • exploring use and location of various residential construction materials used in the construction of a typical house

DF98AF0027D74DF0A359485D0155CD22.description: Investigate specific residential needs (e.g., traffic patterns, number of family members, family needs, individual preferences, diverse cultural and indigenous perspectives, accessibility).

7BF915CD278A4B64BFBE60A1DFFD7097.description: Demonstrate understanding and application of elements and principles of residential design for a family dwelling.

B34A7AA2AC0B492D8449F4EE5C467413.description: Create a residential design for a family dwelling.

657EA911A1AC40288F7FC77DA78C5704.description: Develop a presentation package of a conceptual design.

99A8CD212CD34FA4861B8FDF87B14633.description: Create a conceptual design: Determine rooms. For each room, define use of room, size requirements and any special requirements. Produce bubble diagrams and adjacency matrices to determine circulation patterns and proximity based on functional relationships. Create preliminary box assemblies of volumes. Develop conceptual floor plans and elevations.

12619B293B2D446B88EFADF8CC2E9892.description: Investigate a variety of floor plan room sizes for a selected building (e.g., residential building, commercial, recreational, business) to develop an understanding of conceptual design.

59455976C9D1429FA3163324EF4C660A.description: Develop a general conceptual design for a building based on client needs and preferences.

86FCA20B6F7B45DBA2B3540297C9D0EB.description: Discuss the benefits and challenges of heritage building restoration

5146F28A1B824DD785AA337FD6AD5605.description: Research relevant by-laws related to heritage building conservation.

CE605248932944F7A70A654FB907C6F2.description: Explore local or regional heritage buildings for their unique architectural and historical significance.

A31ADB9E531A4623B0107CD803E5E76A.description: Explore implications of geography (mountain versus valley dwellings, warm versus cold climate regions) on architectural styles.

A445991F766A4BEE8CBF4E61DA477274.description: Explore implications of urbanization (e.g., low density vs. high density communities) on architectural styles

1223471B71C84B28AE9431C1BD024592.description: Investigate contributions of renowned architects (e.g., Clifford Wiens, Frank Lloyd Wright, Julia Morgan, Joseph Pettick, Michelangelo).

FF88D7EE8A424DDC88EDD17DC4F55882.description: Compare historically and architecturally significant roofing types.

CB8C0DC48CEC4B73A2BB631217BAACAB.description: Create a representation (e.g., pictorial timeline, video) of significant architectural designs from various periods and geographical regions

8E483E613433498B8A71B6A30BB20EEA.description: Analyze qualities that distinguish various historical architectural styles (e.g., Indigenous, European, American) and discuss how they have influenced contemporary housing

CB83BD79981443AFA4AA130A9F0B8744.description: Research how individual needs, cultures, religions and social perspectives have influenced architectural styles.

62052F20A67F44AD8518C01F8B7D8C06.description: Investigate architectural styles from various periods and geographical regions.

E4308D0509194343B671CD9D2FC3F0E3.description: Interpret a land use zoning map.

A5E50071D39C46458AE260680F8324A1.description: Produce simple topographical maps incorporating relevant mapping symbols.

4307023F68774453A45742D33D9E4ED9.description: Find map locations based on given legal descriptions.

DF857B567AFB4A48A48AA17DBC0C89EE.description: Explore how data are stored in mapping software, such as AutoCAD MAP 3D, and properly structured for efficient retrieval.

7AB57C54F30145A4BF6DF9501403DD82.description: Explore the set up and use of surveying equipment, including procedures such as: finding angles between bearings; plotting deflection angles on both open and closed traverses; sight levels using engineer’s level and/or transit and rod; determining unknown elevations and entering readings into field notes; and, plotting out a lot.

047D28E9117B40769B38078864CB7292.description: Research and develop a basic understanding of the Dominion Land Survey System.

645E9045D9DB481792FBD96099E6658D.description: Demonstrate an understanding of latitude and longitude.

E14CAAD4247844B5BC2F34738DA986AC.description: Discuss technical terms associated with mapping and surveying

42468588193C43F49B02CAE5DEF3A1AC.description: Investigate purposes and applications of mapping and surveying.

9AB73AE83B5143FCA72F3E5BFEB492F6.description: Create professional layout (e.g., title block, schedules, symbols, balance, scale, sheet sequence). Include annotations and general notes. Provide all dimensions required for construction. Dimension to centre of all openings in metric and/or imperial units. Develop material takeoff and construction estimation.

C61231CBBEEC4A76AB22D936BB83FD59.description: Determine and produce drawings for a sheet set, including: presentation elevation; presentation floor plan; floor plan; foundation plan; elevation plan; wall section; and site plan

5E8B6D3F1DA04A3CB58194B07A0B096F.description: Research terminology related to architectural drawings.

5BB49AFC01694D80B6E12B48593EB0C0.description: Investigate the purpose and use of architectural drawings.

14AC4C9325A14E08AB9B6D6138134F2A.description: Identify and dimension all roads, driveways, and sidewalks.

231E181A45AC4954813669DCF66DE5F7.description: Identify exterior items (e.g., stairs, ramps, platforms, services for water and power) on the site plan.

CC543387E030426C9C079BB2E06632B8.description: Identify property lot lines, lengths, azimuths, orientation and easements on the site plan

0635C3CF5DD74576B9BD411B952B5C70.description: Identify location for the building footprint and overall building dimensions with consideration to easements.

F1B594AABE284862B789E788BE74F32D.description: Identify legal site descriptions (e.g., lot, block, plan number) of the plan

07918C02ED67404E8170E09E1B2F2F02.description: Prepare a complete title block for a site plan.

483382FD58154634AD30C5D71C915D17.description: Create a scale representation of the site in standard scales (e.g., 1:100/1:200/1:500).

E59A94A1E2154CC7A1BA5D79B5FBF883.description: Explore the role of community in regulating site plans.

4056A3D3847A4DD08A32102587D1B65E.description: Research existing site plans in your community.

CE425AE769EF4C9595BFFD7089FA2A07.description: Produce site plans for residential buildings.

7625EDBC39C34EBDBA3C1C3AF8383486.description: Differentiate between nominal and actual lumber sizes.

EE2BF3F2C5994E48A96808052E8D57DD.description: Insert correct symbols for materials used in construction.

C7D8DD9F78AF4C3F84B272BE7EA0152A.description: Draw a completed wall section to scale.

BBB71D68E6EC413C822241157E23E547.description: Determine the boundary of the wall section to be displayed.

A814D9EBB5634A28868DBD6812906CF4.description: Size and locate floor joists according to the National Building Code.

B7C022A448AB4412AD2BD3B51860B6D4.description: Identify exterior wall components (e.g., top plate, bottom plate, studs, insulation, exterior finish, sheet polyethylene, header, blocking).

95DC129E73AA4872B4D74A86DF8D0626.description: Label load bearing and non-load bearing interior walls.

2BD44D9D791F47AA89C91343452CA4BE.description: Identify interior wall components (e.g., top plate, bottom plate, studs).

7B6DD2ACDE2B452F9324DBBF2F1CD475.description: Investigate various types of wall materials with respect to their use, sustainability, cost, individual preferences and energy efficiency.

7AD5EC82D2834031974AC8414FE8CC6A.description: Design roof pitch in accordance with floor plan.

3DB0183B336142B8BB6B36C13A63E896.description: Explore differences among roof types (e.g., flat, gable, shed, mansard, hip).

36CDF55549454D0287CC230DA1835DFA.description: Determine required levels for wall and window heights.

51996A0F08CF4C8781DE9FD14E616653.description: Investigate and develop elevation plans that demonstrate understanding of required technical vocabulary, drawing tools and symbols. Identify grade level on plans. Produce front and side elevations for a set of house plans. Label materials used to finish house exterior and significant elevations (e.g., top of top plate, top of subfloor).

800584E05FB94216B988F7BE722194A1.description: Create elevation plans for residential buildings.

AFD8B17275DD42688C128D67D86FECCD.description: Estimate the cost to construct the completed foundation plan using new resources or reclaimed items.

907F6CD6080A49C3B770F6D2FE9A1F8B.description: Create legend notes that include foundation specifications and other important details.

46212EBC614148D5876BA066E4BC5748.description: Design a foundation plan using appropriate scale ratios that include: • placing foundation walls in relation to the floor plan; placing footings correctly aligned with foundation walls or piles; drawing window openings according to the National Building Code; locating stairs to suit floor plan design; calculating number of columns and spacing required according to the National Building Code; sizing and locating beam(s) according to National Building Code; dimensioning and labelling elements of the foundation plan; and, creating levels in reference to grade.

F404D55DD8F54EB9A6620E8AD58273B0.description: Explore factors (e.g., geographic area, cost, energy efficiency and sustainability) that may influence a foundation plan.

37AA4C5383354D96ACE57EB9DC0DC675.description: Investigate various types of foundations (e.g., ICF-insulating concrete form, PWF-preserved wood foundation, cinderblock, concrete).

6F6766004CCF4F978C1A0867F75EA5EA.description: Create a foundation plan for a residential building.

7B7F821723894A8EB01DCB564FC8938C.description: Explore floor plans which take into account universal design and cultural needs.

6AB088B3525E4630A6BC0E36E327839A.description: Differentiate between a presentation and construction floor plan.

D1ADBFA8FA134E11B68D68708B7BA5D5.description: Capture room information (e.g., room area, room function) in a central database for reference and to identify building trends and preferences for future projects

03FA1255D1EC45CDA0AD9F4D1ADFB2D2.description: Label and dimension rooms using correct architectural symbols and following correct standards

794FF8F76C654E3DB621A8B5B6292D17.description: Provide detail to floor plan by: representing miscellaneous objects (e.g., closets, closet rods, hangers, shelves, balcony handrails, appliances, cabinets); and, dimensioning using correct architectural symbols (e.g., arrows, slashes).

54C389B063CA42B7BC86EBA22C586663.description: Design multiple floor plans to demonstrate understanding of drawing tools and drawing symbols. Draw exterior walls and interior partitions/walls. Insert doors and windows. • Insert plumbing fixtures, millwork and TYP (typical, same as nearby comparable features) on construction drawings. Locate and place stairwell openings and stairs.

DC21339415DA422F84DBAC30E7C96861.description: Discuss and apply terminology (e.g., exterior walls, interior partitions) associated with floor plans.

0DAAB3F2F5534E7E9A05C6008B761FB8.description: Create floor plans for residential buildings.

FC055D2E86AD4C55BDB384E9161F9F45.description: Refine the elevation drawings based on feedback.

63498A89BEF1498CBD4705C060813D6E.description: Present finished product to an audience.

6584A4157ECE4606A1389EEA4BA9E47A.description: Collaborate with peers to share work progress.

27E081621B9E4D67975EBD44C0D5FE0F.description: Produce elevation drawings consisting of all four views including the following processes: creating annotations to identify all exterior building materials; drawing walls and roof, windows and doors, and other visible exterior materials; and, adding landscaping details (e.g., side walk, bushes, trees) and shape and shadow to enhance presentation elevation.

EC582D32D924407CB51FC0248D138EEC.description: Investigate concepts of scale and proportion.

B45A6FEDE20D4CC7B883855D02C6D2B6.description: Distinguish between presentation elevations and working drawings.

A37BEEFA26FA4C0BB6C509154A41146E.description: Produce a presentation elevation for a residential building.

7C5055EDC3364DE3AF494C796139F325.description: Refine presentation floor plan based on client needs and preferences.

A0318A2E2147459B8D931526F4CC2B70.description: Present the finished product to a client.

C20D9E3D0BD549B5ADA15F147398443A.description: Produce finished presentation plan including room dimensions, room labels, door sizes, fixture tags (e.g., shower, shelves) and furniture placement.

D2544F60DAB74136B9F013E9C197D82F.description: Create design sketches based on bubble diagrams and adjacency matrices as developed during conceptual design process that include: • coloured bubble diagram and preliminary floor plan according to zones (e.g., public, private, service); and, • legend with colours and zone titles.

6679DF26AEA34FFFA95D8CB513A6A6CD.description: Discuss ways multiple floor plans can be generated from a single conceptual design

9BE82E7E74D546C390065095F8DB6E26.description: Produce a presentation floor plan for a residential building.

BB50F20BD48040B6B7CDCCF818514F97.description: Develop and maintain a portfolio of completed drawings.

9DD94858FD7047259CFBB43DA4B24DEB.description: Produce prints of rendered images of 3D CAD models by: exporting model to slicing software; manipulating model to correct scale for print; and, determining material for model print

62A7E3546812448EB2CE2E3F08BF82AE.description: Design 3D CAD models using a variety of CAD tools: Explore premade 3D drawings from a variety of views and perspectives. Compare surface characteristics of a variety of 3D objects. Differentiate between opaque and transparent solids. Determine support or raft structures for the model. Add lighting and materials to objects in 3D CAD environment.
